content.title: ANCA-Associated Vasculitis
content.summary: ANCA-associated vasculitides (AAV) are a group of small-vessel vasculitides characterized by necrotizing inflammation and the presence of anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies. They include granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), microscopic polyangiitis (MPA), and eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA).
content.definition: A group of necrotizing small-vessel vasculitides associated with anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (ANCA), characterized by few or no immune deposits and predominantly affecting small arteries, arterioles, capillaries, and venules

GPA.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
GPA.note: Previously known by eponymous name that was changed due to historical concerns

MPA.name: Microscopic polyangiitis
characteristics: Necrotizing vasculitis with few immune deposits

ANCA_mechanism: Release of reactive oxygen species and proteolytic enzymes

vascular_surgery_relevance.peripheral_ischemia: Digital ischemia, gangrene from small vessel involvement
vascular_surgery_relevance.aneurysms: Less common than in polyarteritis nodosa
vascular_surgery_relevance.surgical_considerations: Poor wound healing, tissue fragility, ongoing inflammation

ANCA_testing.interpretation: c-ANCA/PR3 suggests GPA; p-ANCA/MPO suggests MPA

severe_organ_threatening.cyclophosphamide: IV or oral, with rituximab as alternative
severe_organ_threatening.rituximab: Standard alternative, especially for relapsing disease

induction.plasma_exchange: Consider for severe renal involvement or alveolar hemorrhage

monitoring.imaging: Periodic chest CT if pulmonary involvement

definition.@value: Group of necrotizing small-vessel vasculitides characterized by ANCA antibodies and few immune deposits

learning_objectives: Define ANCA-associated vasculitis and list its component diseases
Distinguish GPA, MPA, and EGPA by clinical and serological features
Explain the role of PR3 and MPO antibodies in pathogenesis
Recognize organ manifestations particularly relevant to vascular surgery
Outline induction and maintenance therapy principles
clinical_pearls: GPA has upper airway involvement; MPA typically spares it
EGPA has asthma and eosinophilia; ANCA less commonly positive
Rituximab is now standard alternative to cyclophosphamide for induction
50% relapse rate at 5 years - long-term follow-up essential
